name: DogBuddy
description:
With our iOS & Android Apps and Website, we help busy dog owners find local and reliable dog sitters to take care of their dogs whilst they’re away from home. Through building long lasting relationships online, we make it easier and more convenient for owners to work, rest or play!

We believe that all dogs (and their owners!) should have the freedom to enjoy their lives. Whether that means taking a two week trip of a lifetime, or making time for date night with a loved one, we think that owning a dog shouldn’t get in the way of your day-to-day.

DogBuddy was founded in 2013 by passionate entrepreneurs Richard Setterwall (CEO) and Enrico Sargiacomo (COO) after they each struggled to find a sitter for their own dogs.

Since then, we have now grown to be Europe’s leading online dog sitting and home dog boarding community, offering one of the first “airbnb style services” for dogs in the UK, Spain, Italy, France, Germany and Sweden.

team.title: CEO
team.name: Richard Setterwall
team.bioHtml: Founder and CEO of DogBuddy. Previously CEO of Jobylon.com. Strong business background (McKinsey, PwC Strategy). MSc Financial Engineering - LTH, UCLA Anderson

team.name: Enrico Sargiacomo
team.bioHtml: Strong International Biz Dev background. Worked in telecom for 5 years, founded Bibulu. Passionate dog owner.

team.name: Javier Diaz
team.bioHtml: MSc in Computer Science. 4+ years of mobile development experience with strong research background in complex networks, social computing and signal processing

jobs.title: Senior Business Analyst
jobs.description:
Who we are:

We founded Rover.com with the belief that everyone should have the opportunity to experience the unconditional love of a dog. On Rover, pet parents can easily discover, book, and manage personalized care for their dogs including pet sitting, dog walking, and doggy day care. Founded in 2011, Rover improves and simplifies life for pet parents and the dogs they love. Needless to say (but we're going to say it anyway)—we love dogs!

We're a VC-backed US Tech startup headquartered in Seattle. After our recent merger with our European counterpart DogBuddy we are now on the path to build the world’s largest network of pet sitters and dog walkers. To support us in taking the right, data-driven decisions for further growth we’re looking to grow our European Business Analytics team.

As a Business Analyst at Rover you will:

- Support the quantitative needs of EU business units by digging into huge sets of customer, sitter, and market-level data, then emerge with clear business narratives and recommendations.
- Enable your colleagues to take data-driven business decisions by supporting with test design development and dashboard creation to measure impact
- Work cross functionally to tackle more complex problems such as acquisition and retention forecasting, ROI analyses, supply/demand equilibrium monitoring, and capacity planning
- Act as a thought partner to business stakeholders and senior leadership and provide insights that drive strategy in the realms of investment, headcount planning, and cost management.
- Support and mentor colleagues across the organization to develop their analytical skills, including leading classes of SQL training

Your toolset includes:

- SQL, you are fluent and would feel confident leading a SQL 101 course.
- Python and/or R is a plus.
- Periscope, Tableau, Looker, or similar data visualization tools.
- Excel/Google Spreadsheets and Powerpoint/Google Slides
- Fundamentals of hypothesis testing: experiment design, data sufficiency and statistical power, A/B testing, understanding of meta-significance, etc.

Your qualifications:

- At least 3 years experience working cross-functionally with real-world, complex datasets.
- BS/MS in a business or quantitative field: Economics, Business, Math, - - - 
- Statistics - the main thing is you have learned how to think analytically.
- Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Specifically, you know how to narrate analytical results to business stakeholders and executives in a useful, concise, and actionable way.
- Experience working with data infrastructure / engineering teams to assist with recommendations for organizing data into performant tables.
- Marketing analytics experience and/ or two-sided marketplace experience are a big plus.

Benefits of working at Rover.com:

- Competitive compensation
- Stock options
- Bring your dog to work (and unlimited puppy time)
- Stocked fridges, coffee, soda, and lots of treats (for humans and dogs)
- Free Monday breakfast
- Regular team activities, including happy hours, snow tubing, game nights, and more

You will join an amazing and ambitious global team. You will join the London office to be close to the Marketing and Finance team and will work closely with your teammates in Barcelona and Berlin. You will report to the Head of Biz Ops (Barcelona).
